alert.note: Alert for City of Roanoke; City of Salem; Floyd; Franklin; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 20 at 5:38AM EDT until June 20 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Floyd County in southwestern Virginia... Northwestern Franklin County in west central Virginia... Roanoke County in west central Virginia... The City of Roanoke in west central Virginia... The City of Salem in west central Virginia... * Until 1145 AM EDT Tuesday. * At 538 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent heavy rain and embedded thunderstorms tracking from south to north across the warned area. Flash flooding and flooding are imminent. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Floyd... Boones Mill... Bent Mountain... Copper Hill... This includes the following locations... Roanoke City, Salem City, Cave Spring, Glenvar, Vinton, Copper Hill, Check, Floyd, Boones Mill, and Callaway. This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Bear Rock Branch, Beaverdam Creek, Back Creek, Blackwater River, as well as many other small creeks and streams in eastern Floyd, Roanoke, and western Franklin counties. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Roanoke; City of Salem; Floyd; Franklin; Roanoke
